headline: QUALCOMM (NasdaqGS:QCOM) Shareholders Reject Proposal Amid 10% Drop Over Last Month
summary: At QUALCOMM's (NasdaqGS:QCOM) recent annual general meeting, shareholders rejected a proposal aimed at protecting retirement benefits, highlighting ongoing debates around corporate governance. Over the past month, the company's stock saw a price decline of 10%. This move aligns with broader negative sentiment in the market, as the Nasdaq Composite entered bear market territory due to tariff-induced sell-offs. Technology stocks, particularly semiconductor companies, were among the hardest hit,...

headline: DRIV: EVs Hit A Tariff Speed Bump In 2025 But Still Speeding Along

headline: Why An Intel-TSMC Marriage Makes Sense
summary: Intel (INTC) would maintain a significant stake, while TSMC (TSM) would get a 20% stake in exchange for training and sharing expertise. See more here.
